hypothesis_content.title: Intraday Momentum Exhaustion Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, a rapid 1-hour price surge of >2.5% for BTC, coupled with a spike in the 1-hour RSI(14) above 85 and a decline in spot volume relative to the prior hour, indicates short-term exhaustion and predicts a mean-reverting pullback within the next 4-6 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a non-trending (neutral) environment, sharp, low-volume spikes are often driven by leveraged longs or isolated orders, not sustained demand. Exhaustion signals (high RSI, declining volume) provide a high-probability fade opportunity against the extreme move.
entry_conditions: Current 1H spot volume < Volume of previous 1H candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 2.5% surge move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new 1-hour high above the signal candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Falsified if more than 60% of such signals lead to continued momentum (stop-loss hit) instead of a pullback, particularly if occurring alongside a significant positive funding rate shift.
